definition: Lee Myung-bak (1941-), South Korean businessman, one-time chairman of Hyundai, president of South Korea 2008-2013
plum
surname Li
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
old variant of 博[bo2]
extensive/ample/rich/obtain/aim/to win/to get/plentiful/to gamble

sentences.english: President Lee Myung-bak’s state visit to China will take place from May 27 to 30.
sentences.chinese: 李明博总统将于5月27至30日访问中国。

sentences.english: Lee said South Korea needs to consolidate relationship of trust between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 李明博表示，需要巩固韩中两国间的信赖关系。

sentences.english: Mr. Lee's webcast remarks were translated in English.
sentences.chinese: 李明博的网络发言被翻译为英文。

sentences.english: Supporters of Mr. Roh issued news releases denouncing Mr. Lee and prosecutors.
sentences.chinese: 卢武铉的支持者发表新闻稿指责李明博和检察部门。

sentences.english: However, his successor, Lee Myung-bak, has wrenched policy towards American security once more.
sentences.chinese: 然而他的继任者李明博又把政策扭向了美国安全一边。

sentences.english: Wen made those remarks to President Lee Myung-bak of South Korea.
sentences.chinese: 温家宝对韩国总统李明博做了简评。

sentences.english: The shrillness may disguise disagreement in Pyongyang about how to deal with Mr Lee and Mr Obama.
sentences.chinese: 在平壤，关于李明博与奥巴马的纷争尖锐刺耳。

sentences.english: President Lee is scheduled to meet with President Bush in Washington next month.
sentences.chinese: 预料，李明博总统下个月在华盛顿会晤布什总统。

sentences.english: Lee is passing the half-way point of his single term without much to show in accomplishment.
sentences.chinese: 李明博的首个任期已经过半，但却建树不多。

sentences.english: The question is a  comparison between himself and Lee Myung-bak.
sentences.chinese: 这个问题是对他自己和李明博的一种比喻。

sentences.english: The president says he does not believe Pyonygang would do something.
sentences.chinese: 李明博总统说，他认为北韩不会采取行动。

sentences.english: Still, Mr Lee recently has called for better relations with the Buddhists.
sentences.chinese: 不过，李明博近期呼吁改善与佛教徒之间的关系。

sentences.english: In response, Lee Myung-bak expressed congratulation on the complete success of the second trilateral leaders' meeting.
sentences.chinese: 李明博祝贺第二次中日韩领导人会议取得圆满成功。

sentences.english: The skirmish prompted President Lee Myung-bak to replace his defense minister on Friday.
sentences.chinese: 冲突导致李明博星期五撤换了国防部长。

sentences.english: Obama was seated besides the meeting's host, South Korean President Lee Myung Bak.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马坐在东道主国韩国总统李明博旁边。

sentences.english: The South Korean president has made specific comments on ways to achieve re-unification with the North.
sentences.chinese: 韩国总统李明博就与北韩实现统一提出具体看法。

definition: Park Geun-hye (1952-), Korean politician, daughter of former dictator Park Chung-Hee 朴正熙[Piao2 Zheng4 xi1], president of Korea 2013-2017
Roh Moo-hyun (1946-2009), South Korean lawyer and politician, president 2003-2008
Blue House (Cheong Wa Dae), residence of the president of South Korea in Seoul
Kim Dae-jung (1926-2009), South Korea politician, president 1998-2003, Nobel peace prize laureate 2000
Moon Jae-in (1953-), Korean politician and human rights lawyer, president of Korea from 2017
Chun Doo Hwan (1931-), South Korean politician, president 1980-1988
Roh Tae-woo (1932-), South Korean politician, president 1988-1993
former president
Kim Young-sam (1927-), South Korean politician, president 1993-1998
Park Chung-Hee (1917-1979), South Korean military man and dictator, president 1963-1979, influential in developing Korean industry, murdered by his bodyguard
opposition party
Ban Ki Moon (1944-), Korean diplomat, UN secretary-general 2007-2016
Constitutional Court
South Korean Grand national party
Medvedyev (name)/Dmitry Anatolyevich Medvedev (1965-), Russian lawyer and politician, president of Russian Federation from 2008
Abe (Japanese surname)
